channel.title: If...Then Help
channel.description:
Well I am writing a fishing script for a game called TWO. Anyways the fish dont come at a constant rate. You may get 1 fish after another in 2 seconds and then have to wait another 5 seconds for the next fish. My script fishes 3 fish, then moves on to the next spot and fishes 3 fish, then to the next spot and so on. I want to do it so that if it stands in one fishing spot and gets less than those 3 fish, it will move on. How do I do this?
I also want to do it so that when the script is terminated the client window is closed. Is there any way to do it without giving a command to click the mouse on the 'x' button.

item.title: If...Then Help
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

i’m to tired to think right now, but an you link me to the game (if its an mmo)?

Read full topic

item.title: If...Then Help
item.dc:creator: @Quilby Quilby
item.description:
@Quilby wrote:

Well I am writing a fishing script for a game called TWO.
Anyways the fish dont come at a constant rate. You may get 1 fish after another in 2 seconds and then have to wait another 5 seconds for the next fish. My script fishes 3 fish, then moves on to the next spot and fishes 3 fish, then to the next spot and so on. I want to do it so that if it stands in one fishing spot and gets less than those 3 fish, it will move on. How do I do this?

I also want to do it so that when the script is terminated the client window is closed. Is there any way to do it without giving a command to click the mouse on the ‘x’ button.
